reviews.text: I thought museums of any kind were just boring and an excuse to just waste a day looking at once was. However, as a student, I believe museums are the greatest places on Earth. The ability to be able to see parts of history or generations of art, on display, is something that many take for granted. I got to museum, low and behold I got the view of Nigerian political and cultural history.

The environment is beautiful with some large playground or picnic area for children and adults . I even saw some children come in for excursion.
If you're a picture freak like me, I'm sorry but no camera is allowed inside the building. 
But you can snap outside.

The gate fee is 200 naira which I think is super fair. I didn't get to enter inside though cos I was late for an event but I will surely go another time. 

From what I saw , it's a good place for art lovers and adventurous people.
Good artefacts, poor facility. The government needs to revamp facilities preserving our history
It needs a lot of work and refurbishment but great place to learn about Nigerian history
Went there to get some bronze sculptures registered to leave the country.  Very good and courteous staff. Very impressed.

Nike Art gallery is a nice place to to get your eyes satisfied with different art works, in different sizes and media. It's free for individual visit but it'll involve payment of some token if you'll be visiting in large quantity. The price tag is #10,000 per 20 students. It's a very big gallery where art work of different artist are being exhibited, lot's of artist has exhibited their works and it still allows artists to exhibit works too. Nike art gallery has a very nice view, good security and so on. Lots to say, just pay a visit and I bet you wouldn't regret it.

It’s without a doubt one of the best and biggest Art galleries in Lagos. 
I’m always lost in Art whenever I visit and I leave totally Inspired. The gallery is so Historic and rich in Culture. I’m always proud to take anyone visiting from out of town. The owner Madam Nike, is always so warm and welcoming.. I highly recommend this art haven to all Art lovers, tourists and locals. 
#LagosLivingLagosLoving

The Nike Art Center at Lekki, Lagos, Nigeria is one of the best art galleries that I have visited within Nigeria. It represents great collections of contemporary art work by Nigerian artist. There are copious artworks on display which are also for sale. The atmosphere is conductive, the gallery is well air conditioned and lots of artworks  to be viewed. The owner of the Art Center is doing a commendable work!

A place for art lovers, this place is filled with quality art and it’s so beautiful to sight. The place attracts no fee to enter and you when pictures someone needs to be in the background so it doesn’t encourage plagiarism, you can’t take pictures of someone’s work. It’s a good tourist attraction and most of the arts are up for sale if you find something you just can’t take your eyes off.

If you love art and art pieces, Nike Art Gallery is a must visit for you. It's rich in culture and history. Something native, something modern. You'll definitely find something for yourself and something to gift to friends and family. We had a tour guide that gave us a lot of history about Nike herself. No gate fee, they don't want people taking direct photos of the art work or touching them. But you can take pictures with the art as a background. 
At weekends they have like a mini concert/carnival that starts at 12ish.

Well restored national theater of Athens. Two venues inside the same building, the old historic one, beautifully kept, and a smaller space for more experimental theater. Always top level theater performances of the National Theater. You just can't go wrong by attending a theater performances there. Always too quality level word, and totally not staid!!!

My favorite theater in Athens. The building is amazing and the time you spend there always with hight quality. The area is not that safe but it worth it. Take the metro and choose omonia metro station. It is like 2’ walking from there. Do not hesitate to take an outside photo and of course to enjoy any event, just to realize the unique feeling. Sometimes there are offers on the tickets.
Such a superb place to be. Great theatrical plays on the stage, historical building with modern commodities - stage, lights, new wing!
A great theater for great plays, always enjoyed when I visit
Theater always decent but sometimes excellent

Old time service and menu. Still enjoyed their burger anyway. That's what I'd ask for before anything else. Service is a bit sluggish and uncoordinated but you appreciate that they could be professional. They are up in time for  breakfast. Try the fiesta, another good option for me. Some challenge with parking if you're driving there but I'd advice you don't if you can manage to. Wheelchair accessibility is quite low. Entrance is ok with sitting but parking is really bad for wheelchair owners
Nice eatry
Breakfast. Take away. Drinks

Chinese place. Food is great and not so expensive. Like most Chinese places, it comes in sharing platters and the family can share. Ambience is clean but lighting is not amazing for photos if you are a good blogger. Went on a Saturday evening and it wasn’t so busy. I suspect it is typically like that...

For your delicious Chinese meals!!!

The Zen garden is one of the few restaurants in Lagos where hot, delicious Chinese delicacies are served by a very professional team in a serene environment.

The meals here are reasonably affordable, so  no one is left out of this promising experience.

Whilst within the restaurant, one can catch a few glimpse of some ancient Chinese art works which contribute to the ambience.

I wish I could give a 7 star or even 10 star rating.
1. The security is good and although the parking space is limited, it is well managed as the security guys guide you on parking.
2. The atmosphere is truly and deeply romantic. The lights, the decoration and aesthetics etc.
3. Exclusivity; it has very good provisions for a private meetings. It has several lounges to have group hangouts.
4. The menu; they have a wide variety of choices of very healthy meals and really mouth watering.
5. It has very clean restrooms
6. It has a fantastic bar which is well stocked with all sorts of drinks both alcoholic and nonalcoholic.

You will definitely have a smashing time here.

A very beautiful place. You can take pictures every angle here. Lovely food to incite your tastebuds, i love their prawn spring rolls and Singapore noodles so yummy!!! Its on the high side tho have at least 15k per person to enjoy yourself well

Nice place for a family hang out. 
Food and drinks was good. 
Serene environment. 
They even provided an high chair for my 2year old son. 
Will totally recommend them anytime!!!
It has a really nice ambience and the staff are attentive. The owner was also really pleasant. The food was excellent

A nice cosy place for both a quite meal and for a gala celebration. This place serves some of the choicest delicacies of Indian cuisine aft reasonable price. Being in VI gives it an added advantage of a central location in this busy business district.

I really enjoyed dining here. 
Very extensive menu, lots of super yummy dishes to pick from, heavily Indian inspired.
Calming ambience.
Bar area.
Television sets, you could watch football games here.
Friendly staff.
Very affordable buffet on Sundays.
Hotel & Seminar room facilities.
Nice reception and food
the place is good have plenty of vegetarian options. They are very friendly. Food prices are resonable.They have rooms on the same building.

It is an oasis in Ikeja area in Lagos. 
Elbrate Appetizers and Entree menu. Chilled Draft beer and Authentic Indian Grilled food with fast service and moderate prices you can not wrong. Manager Alok personally takes care of customers.  Remain busy on weekdays and very busy on weekends.  There are lot of regulars.  They also have 20 room motel at the same location.  It is a must if you are in Ikeja area.

Get a bottle of goose, or some captian jack cafe rum and enjoy with some genuine indian food

First class

They need to add more sofas in the dining hall. We found the dinning chairs uncomfortable. Also need to offer booster chairs for toddlers so that the whole family can enjoy their meal and time spent. Please don't serve charred butter naan, not everyone likes it. Overall it's a nice place! Outdoor has a good ambiance. I highly recommend weekdays evening and all weekends.
Went with locals for dinner. Believe me all my local friends liked it. Specially everyone enjoyed chilly chicken and butter naan.
It was fine. I enjoyed myself

My work associate and I thoroughly enjoyed this restaurant. It offered really different options and it took us over 15 minutes to figure out what to order! The flavor profiles of  the entrees were creative and unique. Highly recommend!

As always, incredible. First time experiencing Sunday brunch here and was blown away.  Attention to detail, friendliness and professionalism of the staff, absolute incredible selection and quality of food. Everything was cooked perfectly with mouth watering flavor. I went in thinking I just was just going to have a small meal but couldn't resist all of amazing selections and ended up going back a 2nd and 3rd time. Kudos to the management and ownership as I have been to make locations and consistently have the same things to say no matter which location I visit.

Best brunch in Houston.  Any time I have guests from out of town in for the weekend I make sure to take them to churrascos for brunch and they always love it.  The staff is always friendly and the food is amazing.  Dont skip dessert!

My husband and I came to eat here for the first time was told the food and service was excellent. Our experience wasn't that impressive took a very long time to get our food ordered and we had to tell someone that we were ready to order....no one checked to see if everything was okay other than that the food was good

Came here to celebrate my parent’s anniversary and everything was delicious. Very nice and attentive waiter. I loved how we got there at a time where it was empty and we were the only ones there. According to my dad it’s been renovated since the last time he came here. It’s really beautifully done.

worst experience... prices are crazy.. we ate a dinner of 16k and ended up paying 36k.. this is crazy... they have other extra bills u have to pay after your meal .. i will never go back here.. its just not worth it... the food is just average.. nothing special... the stupid waiters and waitrrss couldn't even understand when i say i want my sushi cooked... wouldn't recommend ..
Great sushi, one of d best
It has lots of traditional Japanese food It makes me feel like I am in Japan but quality isn't the best

I have been to all of the best sushi in Lagos including Izanagi and Shiro. Fusion is clearly in the league of the very best sushi in Lagos. Same quality as what you'd find in fine Japanese restaurant in Europe .
I Absolutely LOVE Fusion. The sushi is amazing and affordable; with more delicious choices on their menu! And their drinks🍹😘 are great too! Try the Strawberry/Pineapple Mojito its a must-have!!

Pearl Garden is a nice Chinese restaurant. The environment is serene and beautiful. Their have a pretty decent menu. Though their foods are a bit pricey, but delicious. The meals are prepared fresh when ordered. It is spacious and they have tables for whatever number of people you are expecting on both the first and ground floor. I believe they have a wheel chair accessible entrance.

A quiet Chinese restaurant with great staff. The food however was average and did not meet my expectation of a Chinese meal. My special fried rice did not wow my palate but the prawn in chilli  sauce was superb. I enjoyed my time here and rate it above other Chinese outlets regardless. Most importantly,  I was offered a bag holder for my stuff and the tea is just as I imagined.

Pearl garden... located at the heart of Lagos party center.. it’s a nice Asian restaurant. Here you can celebrate birthday, anniversary, lunch dates etc... I took a time out Sunday afternoon and it was LIT...Great Ambiance, soft spoken and welcoming staff, hospitality is spot on and neat to the teeth.
Take that special time and check it out

Been a client for almost 15 years... I must say that quality has dropped duringthe last couple of year. Went last in December 2018 and didn't enjoy my meal. Ordered the seafood soup and it was not nice, you can taste the fish skin and taste, Not a good experience. Also the crab balls were not as good as they used to be. The Prawns on Hot plate was delicious as ever
Lovely place and the reception is very warm. I love every bit of my dinner. Will definitely be back for another trilling experience
